1.name: Return / Reject identification
1.description: Identify that this is return / reject message

2.name: Automatic matching
2.description: Match the return / reject message to the original payment

3.name: Automatic matching
3.description: Process the return / reject message and the original payment

4.name: Manual matching
4.description: Send the message for manual match

5.name: Manual matching
5.description: Present partial matches in a dedicated queue (ROFI)

6.name: No matching
6.description: Route the message to the manual queue RoFi as no automatic match was found.

7.name: Matching to Direct / Cover
7.description: Send the message for manual intervention

8.name: Adjust party chain
8.description: Swap the debit and credit parties

11.name: MOP Validation
11.description: Route the payment to Repair queue with a relevant error message

12.name: Payment processing
12.description: Process the payment: Debit and Credit Side Processing, Compliance check, Value Date, Time Hold

14.name: Return / Reject posting
14.description: Copy the original debit account to be the Reject / Return credit account and copy the original credit account to be the Reject / Return debit account. Perform reverse accounting accordingly.

15.name: Return / Reject mapping and formatting
15.description: In SWIFT message: swap the sender and receiver BIC. In outgoing XML message: • The original XML (XML_ORIG_MSG) of the linked original payment • The Instruction ID to F20 • The returned settlement amount to F32 (and adds F33 and F36 if relevant) • Adds F72 with the relevant REJT/RETN codeword • The relevant Reject/Return reason code and MREF codeword with F20 of the original payment

16.name: Manual Reject / Return
16.description: User clicks on Reject / Return button

17.name: Manual Reject / Return
17.description: Generate Reject / Return message: map the Reject/Return payment attributes (according to the message type; either SWIFT RETN/REJT or pacs.004/pacs.002). For SWIFT message, the user is able to choose appropriate Return Reason code to be populated in field 72, and GPP will format the field according to SWIFT standard.

19.name: Deduct fees
19.description: Deduct fees from the returned amount

22.name: Recall request generation
22.description: Display an error message stating that the recall request cannot be generated

24.name: Recall request matching
24.description: Link the Recall Request to the original payment

25.name: Pre-Settlement Recall
25.description: Automatically cancel the original payment and route the recall to the Service Complete queue

28.name: Post-Settlement Recall
28.description: Route the recall to the Service Wait queue

29.name: Recall Reject
29.description: Set the message class and basic properties

30.name: Recall Reject
30.description: Match the Recall Reject to the Recall Request and to the original payment

31.name: Recall Reject
31.description: Routes the incoming recall reject message to Service Release queue for review and release by an authorized user

32.name: Recall Reject
32.description: Raise an alert to advise the user that a recall reject was received.

33.name: Recall Reject
33.description: • Link the recall reject message to the recall message • Set the incoming recall reject message status to Service Complete • Set the outgoing recall message status to Service Rejected

34.name: Recall Reject
34.description: Set the incoming recall reject message status to Service Rejected

35.name: Recall Reject
35.description: Raise an alert to advise the user that a recall reject was received.

37.name: Duplicate check
37.description: Route the message to the Possible Duplicate queue for manual handling.

38.name: Automatic matching
38.description: • Set the incoming return message status to Complete • Set the outgoing recall message status to Service Complete • Link the return message to the original payment and set the original payment status to Returned

39.name: Manual matching
39.description: Present partial matches in a dedicated queue (ROFI)

40.name: Fees
40.description: Fee type and fee formula selection rules (set the charge bearer to SHAR, deduct from payment)

41.name: Credit account derivation
41.description: Set a recall suspense account as the credit account

42.name: Credit account derivation
42.description: Route the message to Repair, for the user to manually select credit account to return the funds to.

43.name: Recall Request Receipt
43.description: Set the message class and basic properties

44.name: Recall Request Matching
44.description: Match the Recall Request to the original payment

45.name: Recall Request Matching
45.description: Generate a recall reject message with the relevant rejection reason code, and transmit it to the originating bank

46.name: Recall Request Matching
46.description: Set the recall message status to Service Release for review and release by an authorized user, after which the system sets the status to Service Rejected

47.name: Recall Request Matching
47.description: Set the status of the recall message to Service Rejected

48.name: Recall Request Matching
48.description: Set the recall message status to Service Wait, and route the original payment message to the Approve Recall queue

49.name: Approve a recall request
49.description: Generate and transmit a return message.

50.name: Deduct fees
50.description: Deduct fees from the returned amount

51.name: Reject a recall request
51.description: Generate and transmit a recall reject message.

52.name: Recall Reject generation
52.description: Open a recall reject message screen

53.name: Recall Reject generation
53.description: Input Originator and Recall Reject Reason

54.name: Recall Reject generation
54.description: • Return the original payment to its previous status • Set the status of the recall message to Service Rejected • Set the status of the recall reject message to Service Complete

55.name: Recall return initiation and generation
55.description: Generate a return message in the relevant format

56.name: Recall return initiation and generation
56.description: • Set the status of the outgoing return message to Complete • Set the status of the original payment message to Returned • Set the status of the incoming recall message to Service Complete
